body: Just read about context sharing, but not really what I am after and seems to have downsides (unchangable frame buffers and OS X creating a menu). I'll just bite the bullet and reload everything graphics-related when window properties are changed, I'll leave this issue open though since I think GLFW_DECORATE GLFW_RESIZE and full-screen state should be changeable in the future.

> Right now I see it is not possible to change the state of these window properties after the window has been created. Are there any plans to allow this?

Yes, at some point after glfwSetWindowMonitor and glfwSetWindowSizeLimits, as they intersect.

What are you planning to use it for?

Thanks for the reply, it's mainly just being able to have the ability to change change from say fullscreen mode, to windowed mode (with a window border) to fullscreen-windowed mode, etc, without having reload the graphics/window.
Ah, then you need neither; just #43.

I think as long as there would be a settable windowed-borderless option as well for the window mode then yes I think that issue would suffice :), upon realization of that issue, this one could be closed if you want.
The thing you are likely referring to is [already done automatically](http://www.glfw.org/docs/latest/window.html#window_windowed_full_screen).
I know the feature already exists, I am talking about changing between the modes however.
The window border will be toggled by glfwSetWindowMonitor. Everything will be as if the window was created with that mode.
Sounds good, will be interested to try it out when it releases

rename.from: Allow changes to GLFW_DECORATE GLFW_RESIZE and fullscreen state
rename.to: Allow changes to GLFW_DECORATE and GLFW_RESIZE

body: Is there any chance of getting this change in 3.2? It'd complement the new fullscreen-windowed mode switching features that have just been added really well (thanks a lot for those!).
Alright, thanks a lot for the info!

Hey, me again. >__> We have decided on a January 2017 release for our game, and we would really like to have a feature to switch between windowed, fullscreen and borderless windowed mode without having to restart for borderless switching. We'd really appreciate if this feature could make it into GLFW by December or so, so that we have time to implement and test it properly! Sorry for double posting!
@theagentd What platforms are you releasing on?
